sub_topic: Prove that every group of order 4 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C4 or the Klein four-group V4.
message_1: What are the two possible isomorphism classes for a group of order 4, and which group structure(s) from those classes satisfy the given condition that every group of order 4 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C4 or the Klein four-group V4?
message_2:
The two possible isomorphism classes for a group of order 4 are the cyclic group C4 and the Klein four-group V4.

The cyclic group C4 has the following structure:

1. It has one element of order 1 (the identity element).
2. It has one element of order 4.
3. It has two elements of order 2.

The Klein four-group V4 has the following structure:

1. It has one element of order 1 (the identity element).
2. It has three elements of order 2.

Every group of order 4 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C4 or the Klein four-group V4, as these are the only two possible group structures for a group of order 4. If a group of order 4 has an element of order 4, it is isomorphic to C4. If all non-identity elements have order 2, it is isomorphic to V4.
